danish_publication: En karl fortalte mig følgende: Hans fader tjente i Töjstrup, og den gang gik skoven helt ned til Töjstrup by, nu er der kanske en hel fjerdingvej op til den. Der i skoven var ellefolk, som var hule op ad ryggen. De kom tit hen til ham, når han var hyrde, og de vilde gjærne liste hans meldmad fra ham, det var jo det, de gik efter. De gik også ind i byen og var slemme til at stjæle der og tage deres katte. Dem spiste de, sagde man. Folkene skulde se nöje på, at deres katte ikke var ene i stuen, for ellers snappede de dem.
english_publication: A farmhand told me the following: His father worked in Tøjstrup and at that time the woods went all the way down to Tøjstrup town, now there’s practically a mile up to it. There in the woods there were elves who had hollow backs. They often came to him when he was a shepherd, and they wanted to steal his sandwich from him, that’s what they were after. They also went into town and they were bad about stealing down there and taking people's cats. It was said that they ate them. People had to be careful that their cats weren’t alone in the living room because otherwise they’d snatch them.
